issue.title: feat: add default encoder for `Pattern` type

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->

## Change Summary
As we allow `Pattern` to be used as a regular type and considering we now support `Pattern` when generating
schema (#1768) it makes sense to also add a default encoder for it

## Related issue number
closes #2045

## Checklist

* [ ] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [ ] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [ ] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [ ] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)

body:
@PrettyWood @samuelcolvin 
Although this resolve the problem with the code provided in this issue, I have now a problem with FastAPI, when returning an object which contains a field of Pattern type.

> mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    | [2021-03-01 15:49:42 +0000] [11] [ERROR] Exception in ASGI application
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    | Traceback (most recent call last):
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/uvicorn/protocols/http/httptools_impl.py", line 398, in run_asgi
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     result = await app(self.scope, self.receive, self.send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/uvicorn/middleware/proxy_headers.py", line 45, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     return await self.app(scope, receive, send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/applications.py", line 199, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await super().__call__(scope, receive, send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/applications.py", line 111, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await self.middleware_stack(scope, receive, send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/middleware/errors.py", line 181, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     raise exc from None
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/middleware/errors.py", line 159, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await self.app(scope, receive, _send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 82, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     raise exc from None
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 71, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await self.app(scope, receive, sender)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 566, in __call__
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await route.handle(scope, receive, send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 227, in handle
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     await self.app(scope, receive, send)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 41, in app
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     response = await func(request)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 209, in app
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     response_data = await serialize_response(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 127, in serialize_response
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     return jsonable_encoder(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/encoders.py", line 57, in jsonable_encoder
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     return jsonable_encoder(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/encoders.py", line 90, in jsonable_encoder
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     encoded_value = jsonable_encoder(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/encoders.py", line 104, in jsonable_encoder
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     jsonable_encoder(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/encoders.py", line 90, in jsonable_encoder
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     encoded_value = jsonable_encoder(
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |   File "/root/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastapi/encoders.py", line 141, in jsonable_encoder
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    |     raise ValueError(errors)
mft_api.1.zpratbdtmkmb@mft.local    | ValueError: [TypeError("'re.Pattern' object is not iterable"), TypeError('vars() argument must have __dict__ attribute')]

When I put back my workaround in my code, it works : 
```python
json_encoders = {
            re.Pattern: lambda v: v.pattern,
        }
```

Well `fastapi` uses its own json encoder and reuses `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE` from _pydantic_ here
https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi/blob/5614b94ccc9f72f1de2f63aae63f5fe90b86c8b5/fastapi/encoders.py#L126-L127
We could maybe add `Pattern` directly in `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE` to make it work

EDIT: @adrienyhuel  Could you try with the code of my PR to see if this solves your issue?

issue.title: refactor: set `Pattern` encoder in `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE`

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution! -->
<!-- Unless your change is trivial, please create an issue to discuss the change before creating a PR -->
<!-- See https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/contributing/ for help on Contributing -->

## Change Summary
Set `Pattern` encoder directly in `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE` to be used by `fastapi`
<!-- Please give a short summary of the changes. -->

## Related issue number
#2045

> Well `fastapi` uses its own json encoder and reuses `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE` from _pydantic_ here
> https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi/blob/5614b94ccc9f72f1de2f63aae63f5fe90b86c8b5/fastapi/encoders.py#L126-L127
> We could maybe add `Pattern` directly in `ENCODERS_BY_TYPE` to make it work


<!-- Are there any issues opened that will be resolved by merging this change? -->

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `changes/<pull request or issue id>-<github username>.md` file added describing change
  (see [changes/README.md](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/blob/master/changes/README.md) for details)
